title: Mini Test 09: Separable Verbs
description: Practice separable verbs (prefix position in different tenses)

questions.text: Ich stehe jeden Tag um 7 Uhr ___.
questions.explanation: Separable prefix goes to end in present tense
questions.explanationDetail: Aufstehen (to get up) is separable. In present tense, the prefix 'auf' goes to the end: Ich stehe... auf. The verb stem 'stehe' is conjugated and stays in position 2. So: Ich stehe auf (I get up).

questions.explanation: Perfekt: prefix stays with past participle
questions.explanationDetail: Anrufen (to call) in Perfekt: an + ge + rufen = angerufen. The prefix stays attached to the past participle. Er hat angerufen (he called/has called). Pattern: prefix + ge + stem + -en/-t.
Abfahren (to depart) is separable. In present tense: Wir fahren... ab (we depart/leave). The prefix 'ab' goes to the end of the clause. Wir fahren morgen ab (we're leaving tomorrow).

questions.explanation: With modal verbs, separable verb stays as infinitive
questions.explanationDetail: Einkaufen (to shop) with modal verb: the separable verb stays together as infinitive at the end. Sie muss einkaufen (she must shop). Modal verb is conjugated, infinitive goes to end as one word.
Aufmachen (to open) is separable. In present tense: Ich mache... auf (I open). The prefix 'auf' separates and goes to the end. Ich mache die Tür auf (I open the door).

questions.explanation: Perfekt: prefix stays with past participle
questions.explanationDetail: Ankommen (to arrive) in Perfekt with sein: an + ge + kommen = angekommen. Er ist angekommen (he arrived/has arrived). Motion verbs use sein, and prefix stays attached.
Ausmachen (to turn off) is separable. In present tense: Du machst... aus (you turn off). The prefix 'aus' goes to the end. Du machst das Licht aus (you turn off the light).

questions.explanation: With modal verbs, separable verb stays together
questions.explanationDetail: Ausgehen (to go out) with modal verb: stays together as infinitive. Wir wollen ausgehen (we want to go out). The separable verb is not separated when used with modal verbs.

questions.explanation: Perfekt: prefix stays with past participle
questions.explanationDetail: Anziehen (to put on) in Perfekt: an + ge + zogen = angezogen. Sie hat angezogen (she put on / has put on). Strong verb with vowel change: ziehen → gezogen.
Aufräumen (to clean up/tidy) is separable. In present tense: Ich räume... auf (I clean up). The prefix 'auf' goes to the end. Ich räume auf (I tidy up).

questions.explanation: With modal verbs, separable verb stays together
questions.explanationDetail: Mitkommen (to come along) with modal verb: stays together as infinitive. Er kann nicht mitkommen (he can't come along). Modal verb is conjugated, separable verb stays as one word at end.
Zuschließen (to lock) is separable. In present tense: Sie schließt... zu (she locks). The prefix 'zu' goes to the end. Sie schließt die Tür zu (she locks the door).
